SEARCH

Class SaveManager

java.lang.Object
SaveManager
public class SaveManager extends Object
Handles saving and loading game data to and from JSON files.

This class provides methods to save the current state of the game, including the pet's attributes and inventory, to a JSON file. It also allows loading the game state from a JSON file, restoring the pet's attributes and inventory.

Example Use: 
 
    SaveManager saveManager = new SaveManager();
    Pet pet = new Pet("Chopper", "Dog", 100, 100, 100, 100);
    Inventory inventory = new Inventory(5, 10, 2, 3);
    saveManager.saveGame(pet, inventory, 1, 1000);
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • SaveManager

      public SaveManager()
      Default constructor for SaveManager.

      Initializes a new instance of the SaveManager class. Does not have attributes or methods to initialize.

  • Method Details

    • loadGame

      public Tuple<Pet,Tuple<Inventory,Integer>> loadGame(int slot)
      Loads the game state from a specified save slot.

      This method reads the JSON file corresponding to the specified save slot, and restores the pet's attributes and inventory. If the file does not exist or is invalid, it returns tuples null values.
      Parameters:
      slot - The save slot number (1, 2, or 3) to load from.
      Returns:
      A Tuple containing the Pet object and a Tuple of Inventory and score.

    • saveGame

      public boolean saveGame(Pet pet, Inventory inventory, int saveSlot, int score)
      Saves the current game state to a specified save slot.

      This method writes the pet's attributes, an inventory and a score to a JSON file corresponding to the specified save slot. If the file cannot be created or written to, it returns false.
      Parameters:
      pet - The Pet object.
      inventory - The Inventory object.
      saveSlot - The save slot number (1, 2, or 3) to save to.
      score - The current score of the game.
      Returns:
      true if the game was saved successfully, false otherwise.
